meanings.definition: The quality or state of being timid.
meanings.sent1: Her timidnesses made it difficult for her to speak up in class.
meanings.sent2: His timidnesses often held him back from trying new things.
meanings.sent3: Despite her timidnesses, she managed to muster the courage to ask a question.
meanings.sent4: The timidnesses in the room were palpable, creating an atmosphere of unease.
meanings.sent5: The timidnesses of the kitten were endearing, as it cautiously explored its surroundings.

meanings.definition: The act or habit of being timid.
meanings.sent1: Avoiding eye contact was a clear sign of his timidnesses.
meanings.sent2: Overcoming her timidnesses took time, but she eventually grew more confident.
meanings.sent3: His timidnesses were evident when he hesitated to join the group.
meanings.sent4: The timidnesses in his voice betrayed his nervousness during the presentation.
meanings.sent5: She tried to mask her timidnesses with a forced smile, but it was still noticeable.
